name: Synthesizer V Project
summary: Learn about .SVP files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Synthesizer V allows users to create, edit, and play back synthesized singing vocals. Users can then export the vocals they've created as .UST or .MID files. Synthesizer V projects, which are saved as SVP files, often contain many different vocal tracks, including primary vocals, backing vocals, and effects applied to those vocals.

While SVP files appear as vocal tracks in Synthesizer V, they are actually plain text JSON files. When you open an SVP file in Synthesizer V, the program converts the text the file contains into the graphical elements that appear in Synthesizer V.

instructions: You can open an SVP file in Synthesizer V (cross-platform). To do so, select File â†’ Open... from Synthesizer V's menu bar. Then, navigate to and open your SVP file.
If you want to view the JSON text your SVP file contains, you can open it in any text editor, such as Microsoft Notepad (Windows) or Apple TextEdit (Mac).

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
